children: “IGOR’S THEME,” the introductory track to the project, was first teased in a
posted on Tyler’s social media platforms on May 1, 2019, shortly after
arose surrounding the album after the release of a
. The track also features uncredited guest vocals from

Tyler uses this track primarily to let the listener know what they are getting into by indulging in this album, and that they will indeed, “feel this one,” if they weren’t expecting to do so already. The track opens with a distorted bass playing one note for 24 seconds. This same bass sound reappears in some shape or form on every song on the album.

children: “I THINK” questions both Tyler’s mental state and his feelings in a romantic relationship. Tyler doesn’t know whether to continue to be vulnerable, because of his partner’s actions and their effect on Tyler, but his curiosity grows and latches on to the bond he has created with this person. This pushes him to believe in love. This develops the theme of love throughout the album, as introduced in the previous track.

children: “RUNNING OUT OF TIME” describes Tyler’s fleeting relationship with a significant other and warn them that a split is imminent.
Thematically, it introduces tension to the love dynamic previously constructed throughout the album.

During Tyler’s Apple Music Concert in L.A, he explained that he showed the album to Kendrick Lamar, where Kendrick praised him about the raw feeling of the album and his overall willingness to ‘sing his truth’. This conversation led him to write this song.

children: On “NEW MAGIC WAND,” Tyler desperately attempts to convince someone he has feelings for to not leave him. However, the person Tyler is in love with is still thinking about their previous relationship with a woman. In the song, Tyler goes to extreme length such as threatening to kill both his love interest and his love interest’s ex-girlfriend in order to get what he wants.
“NEW MAGIC WAND” was first teased in a
posted on Tyler’s social media platforms on May 14, 2019. The song opens with grimy beat, and features a soft synth change during the bridge.
Tyler also referenced this track in a numerous tweets
Tyler also said this was his favourite song from the album through

children: “A BOY IS A GUN*” is one of the more Kanye-esque tracks out of
, as seen by Tyler’s delivery of the chorus and the clear use of “Bound” by the Ponderosa Twins, which was also sampled by West in his 2013 album. The song was first teased in a
posted by Tyler on May 13, 2019. It is one of the softer cuts on the album with the chorus featuring prominent use of a soul sample, and glittery synths and keys littered through out the background.

Tyler seems to be alluding to his possible bisexuality, with the lyrical similes of his lover being like a gun and the title of the track being “A BOY IS A GUN*.” Throughout the song, Tyler compares being with his love interest with gun ownership in several ways.
The title “A BOY IS A GUN*” was inspired by the 1971 French western movie

children: . The track discusses the obsessive and protective nature of being in love, and how controlling it can be. Here Tyler/IGOR acknowledges both the positive and negative sides of being under your lover’s thumb. This is thematically represented in the disjointed second half of the song, where music from the start of the song abruptly cuts in.

. It was first teased in a
posted on Tyler’s social media platforms on May 3, 2019, showing him dancing frantically to the song.
The track makes heavy use of drums and distorted synths, one of the more aggressive cuts from the album. It is also also one of the only tracks that Tyler raps throughout.

children: “I DON’T LOVE YOU ANYMORE” is seemingly about Tyler no longer being in love with this person and finally getting over him, but it’s actually Tyler just pretending and lying to himself, because he was hurt. He does this

The high pitched voice shows that all the anger he expresses through the words is like the overblown anger of a child; no matter how many times he says he doesn’t love them anymore it won’t make it true.
Tyler seemingly accepts the loss of this person and he never wants to fall in love again, but that is only because of
On “I DON’T LOVE YOU ANYMORE” Tyler says that he is no longer in love and is completely over it, yet he still chases this love (to an extent) on the last track
where he finally admits that he can’t let go, with even the final two lines of the album being:
Tyler clearly still has deep feelings for this person, even though he pretended like he didn’t and tried to run away, because he was left scarred. All of this connects back to the track
“EXACTLY WHAT YOU RUN FROM YOU END UP CHASING”
